body:
Nice discussion. On "Potential Models to follow": 1. Build our own html pages **pros:** the best custom features **cons:** some of us, not that much familiar with html, might struggle when creating pages. 2. Github pages: **pros:** it has nice search feature recalling those of [rhinocommon](http://4.rhino3d.com/5/rhinocommon) one: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/c2nk1pk6akR65Iu2gCBJ*C8eKbeoIyrIEl6V-Is4VWixdcOadzZLAOSFQ15PxY4WTs8LvRVTBEbPVohfe8ueNYiZjHQZoyM0/proba.jpg) Connection with already present ladybug repository. **cons:** (personally) I do not like the default github theme. It's too "coder" like, white background, black letters. It would be nice if we could change it to some other one. 3. Free bloggs - wordpress, blogger... (some other ones).
**pros:** That would be visually more appealing than github. It would also allow for more easy creation of pages than "1. Build our own html pages". Wordpress even has a feature to support syntax highlighting for python snippets ([sourcecode language="python"]code[/sourcecode]). Blogger might have than one too, with additional mods. **cons:** both mentioned blogs have a bit "tricky" search engines. "Tricky" - meaning the searching would not look like in case of github or rhinocommon, by topic names, but it will list the topics along with previews: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/c2nk1pk6akQUk-JjAT5y16uuMsMB5AxHwxhw8iVD*OtuRt8zV8sk605L3sKERWelvIDPEX8E1MFQqxaG3nV1ay4XyYVrBQdI/proba2.jpg) Not sure if some additional search module exist for both platforms?
